TaskDescription.Detail: Extracts the data inside the table excluding the header from the tabular data in the web page.

Assist.value: Launch the Chrome browser and go to the page with table information.
Enter the site 'https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_tables.asp' from which to extract table information.

It extracts table information and stores it in the 'this.tableData' variable in the form of a two-dimensional array. If tables are merged, the size of the two-dimensional array may be different from the view, so please check the displayed array type when designating an object.
Specifies the table from which to extract information. When you move the mouse over the table, the range to extract information is displayed, and select (click) it after checking it.
Enter the variable 'this.tableData' to store the extracted information in the form of a two-dimensional array.
In table information, initialize 'this.dataText' before inputting information corresponding to each row cell into 'this.dataText'.
Enter the variable 'this.dataText' to initialize.
Enter '' as the initial value.
Repeats the number of rows in the extracted data to arrange the data into a string.
Enter 'this.row = 0' as the initial value.
Enter 'this.row < this.tableData.length' to repeat the number of rows. this.tableData.length is the number of rows in the table.
Enter 'this.row++' to increase the number of rows processed at each iteration.
Repeat as many as the number of columns in the extracted data to arrange the data into strings.
Enter 'this.column = 0' as the initial value.
Enter 'this.column < this.tableData[0].length' to repeat the number of columns. this.tableData[0].length is the number of columns in the first row of the table.
Enter 'this.column++' to increase the number of rows processed at each iteration.
Enter 'this.dataText' with the information separator ('|') corresponding to each cell in the table information.
Enter the variable 'this.dataText' to store the information in.
Input the table cell information to be input into the 'this.dataText' variable as follows. 'this.dataText+ this.tableData[this.row][this.column] + ' | ''
Enter a line break ('\n') to separate each line in the table information in 'this.dataText'.
Enter the variable 'this.dataText' to store the information in.
Enter the following to add a line break to the 'this.dataText' variable. 'this.dataText + '\n''
A text string containing table information is displayed in a message box.
Enter the variable 'this.dataText' to display as a message box.
Quit your browser.
Enter the browser you want to quit. When input as LATEST_BROWSER, it means the most recently controlled browser.
